text: in the last few minutes it's been
confirmed all the rescue divers have
also reached the surface there's relief
and celebrations for the families who
faced an agonizing wait for more than
two weeks celebrations that re matched
across the country which has followed
every twist of this as images have gone
round the world let's go to our
correspondents Dan Johnson is there at
the cave complex and Martin patience is
at the hospital first though let's go to
Dan yes it's an absolute euphoric
atmosphere here people are so pleased to
have had such a successful outcome from
this rescue operation because it's been
such a tense two weeks and we felt the
relief wash over people in waves
distress has been taken away in layers
as those ambulances have left this site
carrying those boys and their coach to
hospital the 13th ambulance left here a
couple of hours ago taking the last of
that group on his way to get the
treatment that is now needed as these
boys and their coach start the recovery
from what has been an 18 day ordeal
inside the mountain behind me deep down
in the flooded cave in the most
difficult of conditions there is
admiration for the strength the
determination the self belief of those
boys the endurance that they have shown
during this ordeal there's also respect
for the skill the exceptional ability
the care and delicacy of the rescue
operation that was put into plan here by
the international diving experts who
came from around the world to offer
their experience and expertise in
solving this impossible puzzle every
option looks so tough there was so much
danger so many downsides but they worked
through it all they considered all the
risks they found the right way to get
these boys out and everyone here is
elated that there is an entirely
successful conclusion to this mission
we've just heard that the last of the
rescuers has made it out alive the
officials in charge said it wasn't
mission accomplished until that was the
case until everyone was safe while they
are now and the celebrations can begin
